body_html:
I meant `x.svd()` (motivated by `native_functions.yaml`). I thought `torch.Tensor` documented these `methods`. Are you suggesting partitioning these methods into multiple classes?
…
On Fri, Sep 7, 2018 at 9:20 AM Soumith Chintala ***@***.***> wrote: by methods, do you mean x.svd() or x.linalg.svd()? We should break down torch.Tensor documentation into sections. body:
I meant `x.svd()` (motivated by `native_functions.yaml`).

I thought `torch.Tensor` documented these `methods`. Are you suggesting
partitioning these methods into multiple classes?

On Fri, Sep 7, 2018 at 9:20 AM Soumith Chintala <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> by methods, do you mean x.svd() or x.linalg.svd()?
>
> We should break down torch.Tensor documentation into sections.
> Once we click on torch.Tensor, it should expand into categories like
> torch.nn
>
> [image: screen shot 2018-09-06 at 11 49 18 pm]
> <https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1310570/45197476-83d85500-b22f-11e8-9309-d2e2978803b7.png>
>
